intro: Metanarthecium luteoviride f. latifolium, commonly known as the yellow-green moss, is a variant of the species Metanarthecium luteoviride. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically yellow-green in color. The plant belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its structure consists of a dense, cushion-like growth form with closely packed, short shoots. The fronds are usually smooth and lack the pronounced midribs seen in other mosses.
